intro: Austroblechnum divergens, commonly known as the New Zealand cliff fern, is a species of fern native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, lance-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows on rocky outcrops and cliffs, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its fronds are usually dark green and have a leathery texture, which helps it withstand harsh weather conditions. Austroblechnum divergens plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various invertebrates.
